Posts.Content: On 5/26/2007 Lisap wrote: I also just found out my cancer has spread to my bones and my liver.  My original diagnosis was in 2005 with bi-lateral cancer in both breasts. I had a double complete mastectomy with the usual rounds of neo-adjuvant and adjuvant chemo and radiation. My breast re-construction failed.  Then after 18 months of chemical menopause, my periods returned, so I had my ovaries removed and was put on aromitase inhibitors. My tumor blood work was fine in Feb. of this year, then two weeks they were measured again and found to be 135.  Quite a jump from normal.  So I did the round of CT and bone scans yesterday to find out I had mets to the bones in 4 spots and also a very large 3" aggressive lesion on my liver. The doc. wants to biopsy the liver due to the aggressiveness of it.  Also will set up radiation for the bones and put me on chemo again and either Tykerb or Herceptin, depending upon the results of the biopsy.  He did mention doing an embolism to the liver (cutting of the blood supply to that one part) to make that part of the liver die off.  Your liver one of the organs that can regenerate itself, (along with your skin). I thought I had this thing licked.  It's so disappointing to get these results.  My husband is devastated.  I am 46yo with 5 children ages 6-16 and we have no family that can help now or when I die. So, I am not as young as you, but still have a young family - and I can relate.   Hi, I read your story and I two do have breast cancer that spread to my liver. In 2003 I had five spots on my liver and they gave me 6 months to live, it is 2007 and I am still alive.The doctors don't know and you should not give up I have friends with the same diagnoses and they took their chemo and they were find, My advise to you is don't give up fight for your children, they need you, that is what I am doing and I don't mension the C word ever, and I say I am going to get my medicine. When I had the 5 tumors in my liver what worked for me is Navilbine and Herceptin, It killed them all, for about a year and a half and it slowly came back. I do have to go back to chemo because my tumor in my liver is bigger it is 6cm and my liver specialist told me to go get my treatment and then, he can shrink the tumor in my liver with the chemo embolizationin my liver. Hang in there , you will be fine.                                     I will remember you in my prayers                                                   Mary
Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: A friend told me about this web site and told me there are wonderful and caring people on this web site to talk to, as I was reading different stories my heart went out to all of you and my prayers and blessing are with you all. You all are very courageous people. I to can relate to you all I have been battleing breast cancer for Five years, which has spread to my liver. My last chemo treatments where Navilbine and Herceptin. When I started out I had Five spots in my liver and now I am down to One left a this one just won't go away. My doctor told me just recently that the Herceptin stopped working so they took me off it, and they want to do and Liver Biopsy of to take the tumor out of my liver. I am really scarde to let them touch the tumor, for It has been there for Two years and never spread to any other parts of my body. I am afraid if they touch it they will spread the cells to others parts of my body, Is this true. Can someone who had a similar experience write me back to let me know will the cells spread if I let them do a biopsy or take the tumor out. My oncologist will not put me on any treatments until he gets a tissue sample. Any help on this matter. They never gave me a liver biopsy when they first saw it in my liver. Now they want a biopsy before he gives me more chemo to kill this last tumor. Does this biopsy spread cancer cells to other parts of your body? Win The Fight
Posts.Title: Stage iv Into Liver

Posts.Content: Hi, It's Mary again, I want to Thank Sis and Iris D for responding to my message. It's been almost a year since then and they did the biopsy and I was fine. I have recently gone on the protocal drug Tykerb and Xeloda and did really well with it for about 6months and the tumor started to grow again. The doctors want to do chemo embolization to my liver to kill the tumor, which I will have soon. Has anyone every had this and has it helped? Also can anyone recomend a natural doctor who is good. And has anyone had Carbo and Gemzar for breast cancer that spread to the liver and did It help, that is my other option. The doctors tell me I am a bit different case to only have breast cancer and for this long to only spread to my liver, is there anyone who has had this for 7years and it only spread to your liver?                             Mary
Posts.Title: Stage iv Into Liver

Posts.Content: On 7/11/2007 Lisadiane wrote: Hello Laretta, You are so right. I have started going back to church. I got down on my knees as well and thanked God for all the blessings in my life and gave the rest to him. The problem I have is I keep taking it back, I keep telling myself not to worry god will show me the way. I know he will I just need to keep praying, stay close to family and friends, and I will get threw this. Thanks so much for your responce it was just what I needed. God Bless, Lisa     Hi Lisa, I am sorry to hear about what is happening in your life now, I  will put you in my prayers. I am to going thru the same situation, my husband blamed me for getting breast cancer and decided to cheat on me, I to am going to start my fourth breast cancer treatment alone again, I used to think I can't do this alone, but some kind of strength comes up inside you and you just do it, it's like god's way to show you how stronge you really are. I have my days and I am sure you do to, just remember you will get thru this with or without him, and if you need a friend I will be there for you. God knows we do need them.
Posts.Title: Divorce and Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Jodie, Sorry to here that the dreaded C has returned, don't give up I have been going thru this for seven years, and thanks to god and alot of prayers I'm still here. I thought I read you were Her2 Postitive and it's overexpressing, that's what I am and I was on Herceptin since 2003, and it stopped working on me,  and I was Proges neg. and Estrogen neg. and they put me on the drug. and it kept me alive. I just recently went on the new Tykerb drug and it worked for me, but usually they put you on Herceptin first, I would get a second opion.                    Good Luck and hang in there                          Mary
Posts.Title: br. ca. returned and is now mets..

Posts.Content: Hi, I have been on Femara for about 1 year and don't have the symtoms you describe, but I also have Fibromyalgia, which there is alot of muscle pain with that,I take a drug called cataflam which works wonders,maybe you should ask your doctors about this drug. I take 50mg twice a day. and I also take my Femara and I do not get the muscle pain you are talking about. I hope this will help you. Write back and let me know what your doctor says about the cataflam. My sister has reumitoid arthritus and It works wonders for her to. Good Luck. Win The Fight
Posts.Title: Femara Muscle Pain

Posts.Content: Hi, That is Great!!!!!!!! I am curious what chemo did you take the first time for Stage IV, and where did it spread to? I am Seven years of having Stage IV into the liver. In 2003 I had Five spots in my liver and took Navelbine and Herceptin and they all went away for a year and then came back and I have been on Xeloda and Herceptin, which worked for awhile and then stopped. I would love to know what chemo drug you took to keep you in remission for that long and are you Her 2 Positive. What are you going to take now?                                        Please E-mail me back at:--Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html--                                              Thank you
Posts.Title: Stage iv second time and 12 years later

Posts.Content: On 7/3/2007 Ashlyn0123 wrote: My mom has metastatic breast that moved from lungs to liver and now in the brain. She has HERS 2/NEU + cancer, very aggressive and moves quickly and systemically. She was given a 6mth or less dx last April and we are now a year and a half out and still fighting. this web site helped us understand www.cancer-prevention.net she would be dead by now if we hadn't applied some of these things. She is on Xloda and Tykerb it hasn't done anything for her so she stopped the regiment, we are trying another, but don't give up i have heard good things about the combo. We are using natural and modern medicine and that combo is working she looks and feels great and to look at her you would never know what is going on inside her body.   Hi, I read your message, It great your mom is feeling better I two went on Tykerb and Xeloda and it did nothing for me. Actually it spread from my liver to my lymth nodes. So they are going to try Gemsar and Carbo. Has anyone been on this and does it work. Also can you tell me what your mom is on now and also the natural approach, of what she is on. My liver specialist want to go in with chem-embolozation to kill the tumor in my liver and then use Gemsar and Carbo to treat the lymth nodes. Has anyone been on either treatment? And how well do they work,.                                                 Mary
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer to Liver Cancer
